pr_title: Fix caching and case-sensitivity issues with enum type signatures

timeline.bodyText: This library is a part of our SPI, and we are trying to keep it clean of any dependencies. Is there an implementation in Java? If not - then we should probably implement it / copy it to the source.
timeline.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: @arhimondr I now vendored in the code from apache, lmk if that works
replies.author: daniel-ohayon

timeline.bodyText: why not to keep it in lower case?
timeline.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: because the base32 decoder expects uppercase letters in its encoding
replies.author: daniel-ohayon

timeline.bodyText: Why are only the values that are encoded with base32? Are the keys not prone to this problem?
timeline.author: arhimondr

replies.bodyText: the keys must be case-insensitive because they can be used as qualified names (SELECT country.UK) which must be case-insensitive according to the SQL spec iiuc
replies.author: daniel-ohayon

timeline.message: Use base32-encoding in enum type signatures
Add hashCode to VarcharEnumType and LongEnumType
Vendor in Base32 codec from apache.commons.codec
Use base32-encoding in enum type signatures
Add benchmarks for big enum signatures
Add benchmarks for big enum signatures
